intro: Angelica czernaevia, commonly known as the Siberian angelica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and large, compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. Its roots are thick and fleshy, often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Angelica czernaevia thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to high-altitude conditions.
